intro: Hieracium secundistrictum, commonly known as the lesser spearthistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a spiny, upright stem with narrow, hairy leaves. Its flowers bloom in the summer, producing yellowish to brownish composite flowers that attract various pollinators.
